column1: #Text=is a historical , open source , strategy game , published by Wildfire Games .
#Text=It focuses on the period between 500 BC and 500 AD .
#Text=The game will be released in two parts : the first covering the pre-AD period , and the second running to 500AD .
#Text=With development well underway , Wikinews interviewed the development team .
#Text=Video clip of 0 A.D. Image : Wildfire Games .
#Text=Aviv Sharon , a 24-year-old Israeli student responsible for the project 's PR , compiled the below Q&A , which the full team approved prior to publication .
#Text=Could you introduce the development team of 0 A.D. ?
#Text=We are Wildfire Games , a group of approximately 15-20 people from around the world developing 0 A.D. , a free , open-source game of ancient warfare .
#Text=Cumulatively , about 100 different people have contributed to 0 A.D. over time .
#Text=Our ages have ranged from 15 to >65 and our locations range from North America and Europe to India and New Zealand .
#Text=The contributions to 0 A.D. are coordinated by a team of department heads led by a lead producer , Erik Johansson ( feneur ) , who is 25 years old from Sweden .
#Text=All contributions to 0 A.D. so far have been on a voluntary basis only .
#Text=To speed up development , however , we have decided to raise enough money to support 160 hours of paid development of the 0 A.D. codebase .

#Text=We have tentatively selected the team member who will receive this compensation , Philip Taylor ( Ykkrosh ) , but decided to hold off for a few months until we start using these funds to wait until he has more time to dedicate to 0 A.D. development .
#Text=Otherwise , 0 A.D. development will continue to be voluntary , and all funds donated to 0 A.D. will be used for team expenses only , such as website hosting costs .
#Text=Why did you want to make games ?
#Text=Originally , 0 A.D. was born out of a desire to innovate within the RTS genre .
#Text=We felt , and still feel , that this genre has a lot of potential for innovation and we wish to explore that with some different rules .
#Text=0 A.D. started out as a total conversion mod for Age of Empires II :
#Text=The Age of Kings , until team members at that time ran into the limitations of changing a closed-source game .
#Text=Hence , as a wish to break free from the limitations of other games ' engines , the standalone version of 0 A.D. was conceived and its development continues to this day .

#Text=Some other reasons include a deep appreciation of ancient history ; the wish to improve our skills and be recognized for our talents ; and a determination to prove that a group of volunteers collaborating over the internet can make a game that rivals the commercial , proprietary AAA titles .
